name: Basílica dels Sants Màrtirs Just i Pastor

reviews.text: If you've been to Barcelona, you've of course gone to the Gothic Quarter and visited the Cathedral. And well worth visiting, too. But Gótico has a ton of interesting other things, and if you have a few extra hours, will repay aimless wandering. I did some of that the other day, myself, and found this fascinating basilica only a couple of streets south of the main cathedral. South by southeast, of course. You know. Anyway, this is a cool looking church from the outside and even cooler on the inside, with some really prime stained glass. I like new, flashy, modern glass like in that Gaudi place up the way, but there's something special about old, dark windows from the 1500s. Don't miss the 2 euro bell tower, either. I missed it, and I'm just itching to get back and do that. I suspect there's a good view of the Barcelona cathedral from it; it's close to the Jaume I metro.
The Basílica dels Sants Màrtirs Just i Pastor (Església dels Sants Just i Pastor) is a beautiful church in the Barri Gotic. Tradition says that it is Barcelona's oldest Church. Worth visiting.
